record.dc:title: 148GP22, 15GP22, Greenup County, Kentucky. Hardin Village. Large and Small Pits, Features 70 And 84.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Fort Ancient Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Close-up of pits 70 and 84. Note: Slab in Pit 70. Feature 70: Nearly circular pit, with shallow, slightly sloping, shelf at side. Pit itself has straight sides to a depth of about 1.9 feet, where they slope sharply to a conical bottom. Fill dark, containing much midden material, a cache of deer heel bones near the top, and the large limestone slab shown in drawing. Feature 84: Shallow, round pit, sloping walls, concave bottom, dark fill. Neck leads to a group of irregular holes.
record.wpa:comments: More information, including diagram, available at institution.
